intro: Cotula poekilophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leaf daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its small, daisy-like flowers with white petals and yellow centers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in open grasslands. Cotula poekilophylla has narrow, linear leaves and is often used in ornamental gardening due to its delicate appearance. It is also valued for its ability to thrive in arid conditions.
